III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
1

(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1:
On 7/17/25, a youth was smoking a vape at the facility. There is a
concern that staff or other youth who have visiting home privileges
have been distributing vapes to other youth at the facility.
Allegation 2:
Staff 1 has smoked a vape at the facility
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via phone on 8/6/2025. Complainant
did not provide any additional information.
Staff 1 and Staff 3 were each interviewed separately face-to-face
at the facility on 8/8/2025. Each denied being present the day of
the incident on 7/17/2025 and denied knowing how Youth A
obtained a vape. Each denied seeing Youth A or any other youth
at the facility with a vape. Each reported if a vape is found at the
facility it is confiscated and management is notified.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 8/8/2025.
Staff 2 reported being present on 7/17/2025. Staff 2 reported she
and another staff, identified as Staff 5, who no longer works at the
facility, took the youth bowling. Staff 2 denied observing Youth A
obtain the vape or knowing how he obtained it. Staff 2 reported a
staff on the next shift found the vape next to Youth A and
confiscated it. Staff 2 denied herself or knowledge of other staff
providing or sharing vapes with any youth at the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone 9/3/2025. Staff 5 reported being
present for the bowling outing on 7/17/2025. Staff 5 reported
Youth A returned from the bowling alley with a vape. Staff 5
reported when they returned to the facility she then left with
another youth to go to therapy so she did not see how the
situation was handled. Staff 5 reported seeing the vape on the
couch next to Youth A before she left. Staff 5 reported Youth A
told her and Staff 2 he found the vape on the ground outside the
bowling alley. Staff 5 denied having a vape and giving it to Youth
A.
2

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 8/8/2025.
Youth A reported Staff 5 gave him the vape during the bowling
outing on 7/17/2025. Youth A reported he lied before saying he
found it on the ground so Staff 5 would not get into trouble. Staff 5
reported when staff discovered the vape they attempted to
confiscate it and he refused to give it to them so police were
called. Youth A reported he was taken to juvenile detention.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 8/8/2025.
Youth B denied seeing a vape at the facility at any time. Youth B
reported he heard about the incident with Youth A having a vape
and stated he did not know how he got it. Youth B denied hearing
or witnessing any staff giving vapes to youth at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 8/8/2025.
Youth C reported Youth A brought a vape to the facility. Youth C
reported he did not see Youth A find the vape but Youth A told him
he found it outside the bowling alley. Youth C denied hearing or
witnessing staff give youth vapes at the facility.
Allegation 2:
Interviews:
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/11/2025.
Staff 2 denied observing any staff smoke vapes or any other
substances at the facility.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/11/2025.
Staff 4 reported being aware that some staff vape. Staff 4 reported
the only staff she has seen at the facility vape in the building was
Staff 1. Staff 4 reported smoking is not permitted at the facility.
Staff 4 reported she has seen Staff 1 smoke multiple times while
working with the most recent time being in the last couple of days.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone 9/3/2025. Staff 5 reported staff
vape in front of youth at the facility. Staff 5 identified Staff 1 as a
staff she recalled seeing smoke at the facility.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 9/11/2025.
Supervisor reported she has seen one staff use a vape at work
and identified the staff as Staff 1. Supervisor could not recall when
the incident occurred. Supervisor reported she addressed the
situation with Staff 1 and Staff 1 put the vape in her car.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 8/8/2025.
Youth A reported seeing Staff 5 with a vape and smoking it. Youth
3

A denied observing any other staff vaping or with a vape at any
time.
Youth B, and Youth C were each interviewed separately on
8/8/2025 and 9/11/2025. Each denied seeing any staff with vapes.
Each denied witnessing any staff smoke any substances at the
facility or in the community.
Documentation Review:
• Drug Free Work Environment and Drug and Alcohol Policy
prohibit smoking any substance at the facility.
• Email authored by Program Manager states Staff 5 is no
longer employed with the facility. Email states Staff 5 does
not have any disciplinary record.
• Incident Report dated 7/17/2025. IR is consistent with
reporting above detailing Youth A was observed with a
vape at the facility.
• Documentation of Supervision states Staff 1 smoked a
vape pen in the facility. Document includes Staff 1’s signed
statement that she smoked a vape pen at the facility.
Analysis Allegation 1:
A rule violation is not established regarding allegation 1. There is
insufficient evidence to support a staff provided a vape to Youth A.
Interviews and documentation support staff intervened
appropriately when it was discovered Youth A had a vape on the
premises.
Allegation 2:
A rule violation is established regarding allegation 2. It was
supported with interviews and documentation Staff 1 smoked a
vape on the premises which is against facility policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
